results.abstract: Article on return of programming exec Paul Klein to NBC after 5 yr absence notes that he was influential in development of series called The Big Event, in which real events will be telecast (M)

headline.main: Notes: The Rewards of Being A Network Ex-President

results.snippet: One reason Robert Wood received a handsome four-year deal to produce programs exclusively for CBS after his recent resignation as president of the network was that it would keep him from doing what Fred Silverman is doing. Silverman, who had been...
results.lead_paragraph: One reason Robert Wood received a handsome four-year deal to produce programs exclusively for CBS after his recent resignation as president of the network was that it would keep him from doing what Fred Silverman is doing. Silverman, who had been program chief for CBS until last spring, went to ABC in a similar capacity and is using all the skills he mastered at CBS against his old team.

results.abstract: Sen John Glenn says he will be available as running mate for Carter; says Carter will clearly take Ohio primary on June 8 and nomination (S)

headline.main: Glenn Says He Would Run On Jimmy Carter Ticket

results.snippet: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 10 (UPI)--Saying that Jimmy Carter has the Democratic Presidential nomination locked up, Senator John Glenn, Democrat of Ohio, has indicated that he would be available as a running mate for the former Georgia Governor.
results.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 10 (UPI)--Saying that Jimmy Carter has the Democratic Presidential nomination locked up, Senator John Glenn, Democrat of Ohio, has indicated that he would be available as a running mate for the former Georgia Governor.

results.abstract: James Reston on possible Vice Pres nominees and how they will be chosen; sees likely repeat of typical last-min scrambles that resulted in nominations of Sen Thomas F Eagleton and ex-Vice Pres Spiro T Agnew; cites likely Vice Pres choices of Carter, Ford and Humphrey
results.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 18 With the Michigan and Maryland primaries behind us, it may not be too early to survey the field of potential VicePresidential nominees; but if the leading Presidential candidates are thinking about their running mates, they are...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 18 With the Michigan and Maryland primaries behind us, it may not be too early to survey the field of potential VicePresidential nominees; but if the leading Presidential candidates are thinking about their running mates, they are keeping their secrets to themselves.

results.abstract: John J O'Connor article on investigative journalism by TV and using as example June 8 segment on safety of nuclear power by CBS News's '60 Minutes' program; criticizes techniques used, holding they border dangerously on false pretense and entrapment; describes research he did (L)

headline.main: TV VIEW; Fair Play Or Foul on '60 Minutes'? TV VIEW Fair Play or Foul on '60 Minutes'?

results.snippet: The inevitable clash between action and reaction seems to have intensified for journalism these days. The post-Watergate honors due the profession are being followed by increasingly tough questionings of methods and practices. While Bob Woodward and...
results.lead_paragraph: The inevitable clash between action and reaction seems to have intensified for journalism these days. The post-Watergate honors due the profession are being followed by increasingly tough questionings of methods and practices. While Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein as played by Robert Redford and Dustin Hoffman in "All the President's Men" are currently being embraced at movie box offices, the latest book by the two Washington Post reporters, "The Final Hours," is being severely ...
